H0.text: Gene mutation is the process most responsible for the extinction of most species of plants and animals that have lived on Earth.

H1.text: Environmental changes are the process most responsible for the extinction of most species of plants and animals that have lived on Earth.

H2.text: Selective breeding is the process most responsible for the extinction of most species of plants and animals that have lived on Earth.

H3.text: Decrease in reproduction is the process most responsible for the extinction of most species of plants and animals that have lived on Earth.

A4.text: Flood basalt events could produce dust and particulate aerosols, which inhibited photosynthesis and thus caused food chains to collapse both on land and at sea.

A5.text: Movement of the continents into some configurations can cause or contribute to extinctions by changing ocean and wind currents and altering climate.
